text: Elizabeth Garrett Anderson (9 June 1836 â€“ 17 December 1917) was an English medical doctor and sister of Millicent Fawcett. She is known for being the first woman to qualify as a doctor and surgeon in Britain and for starting a medical school for women. She was also the first female mayor in Britain. She had three children. She taught herself French to go to the University of Paris. Category:1836 births Category:1917 deaths Category:English physicians
title: Elizabeth Garrett Anderson
